abstractText: The purpose of survival monitoring is to assess the survival of containerized woody shrubs and trees and/or transplanted shrubs and trees installed as part of floodplain revegetation treatments. Floodplain revegetation treatments such as planting container-grown trees and shrubs seeks to establish native woody cover on restored floodplain surfaces as a means of providing bank stability, natural woody debris recruitment sources, and native cover type distribution throughout the project area.
title: Vegetation Survival Monitoring v1.0
